text:
Non poteva scegliersi un video più adatto alla canzone e al suo testo.
La vista offuscata, il paesaggio ingiallito, un lungo (e piatto) percorso senza una destinazione ben precisa, ma si è costretti ad andare avanti… perché ci si trova per strada.
E percorrere un breve tratto di strada ad una velocità sempre costante, senza entusiasmo… forse perché si è appunto “costretti” a tirare dritto.
Ma poi nel finale il colpo di scena: l’auto accelera e supera l’altra auto, che sin dall’inizio del video stava davanti… forse la “nostra” auto la stava inseguendo (senza mai raggiungerla) o forse stava provando a superarla, senza riuscirci.
Ciononostante la cosa più bella del video è il sorpasso finale… probabilmente dimostra che col tempo tutto passa ed è possibile “superare” qualsiasi cosa o addirittura chiunque.
author: Sergio Ignazio La Vela

text: I'm usually surrounded by so many people but feel alone because none of them even understands me or even makes an effort to. it just exposes their insincerity. shows you that they're just taking out of you and not giving any in return. which eventually empties your heart and leaves all sorts of bad feelings there. and as hard as I try to distance myself from these people I end up going back to them because I need someone to talk to. to keep me out of my mind, which I don't like staying in. there's two options for me the way I see it. Sell myself to these leeches and become empty and shallow. or . be alone and then inevitably go mad. or perhaps there's a third option. one that addresses these issues. I hope I find it or someone helps me before it's too late and I do something that ruins me. Does anyone understand. even a little?

text:
I remember when I was 11-12 I was laughing about depression, sadness and loneliness. Now I'm 17 and have literally no friends. I hate my life, I hate waking up everyday just to go to school and see all the people just laughing and having good time. When I sit in class I hear ppl talking about party that was last weekend, how fun it was. Just behind my back. It seems like universe hates me because every fucking time I try to change my life nothing is happening. The harder I try, the worse results are. I feel like if I have disappeared no one, except my family, would care. No one wants to hang out with me. If you have a real friend, appriciate the fuck out of them. Seems like a simple thing but some people can't have even them. I'll probably spent my 18th birthday alone.
I'm devastated.
If god exists he's a fucking psycho

text:
A road trip is a great idea for fighting loneliness. Because you're out there on the road seeing other people who are looking to fight the loneliness in their lives.
They are trying to commune with their fellow countrymen and women.
I used to do this when I had a new car and ventured out into southern New Mexico, stopping in at recommended roadside restaurants in small towns along the way for some great food.

.    *How To Fight Loneliness                    외로움을 이겨내는 법*

How to fight loneliness                           외로움을 이겨내는 법
Smile all the time                                     항상 웃어야 하리
    
Shine your teeth 'til meaningless          공허하도록 앞니 반짝이며
Sharpen them with lies                           화려한 거짓말도 곁들이며

And whatever's going down                  그럼 모든 멋진 일들이
Will follow you around                            나를 따라다니리

That's how you fight loneliness            그렇게 해서 이겨내리
You laugh at every joke                          조크마다 웃어주며

Drag your blanket blindly                        이불 덮어쓰듯 눈 감고
And fill your heart with smoke               가슴은 담배연기로 채우며

And the first thing that you want           전혀 필요 없는 것들에만
Will be the last thing you ever need      필사적으로 달려들며

That's how you fight it                            그렇게 이겨내리
  
Just smile all the time                            항상 그저 웃어대며
Just smile all the time                            항상 그저 웃어대며

Just smile all the time                            항상 그저 웃어대며

text: This is the first and only song I've heard so far by Wilco, and I am in love with it. It's a beautiful song, in many ways, and I think everyone has felt this way at least once in their lives. He really captures the feelings and the motions you go through just to try to CONVINCE the world, and more importantly, YOURSELF-- that everything is okay-- when that couldn't be farther from the truth. But you HAVE to be convincing. You have to be the reluctant actor. You have to play pretend so well that even you, the playwright of this entire production, the only one who truly knows what's behind the curtain, can still believe it even just a little... So you can keep going. So you can say, with conviction, "everything is okay." Yes, don't worry, everything is okay. "Smile all the time." Hey, it's okay. I'm fine. "Laugh at every joke."  I am okay. I promise. "Shine your teeth 'til meaningless." ...Can't you see, clearly I must be alright? You can't look through me if I turn myself to stone. ...Don't let them see you crumbling. Nobody can break this condemned tower down but you. Total catharsis. And then you rebuild-- You rebuild the fuck out of that tower, you make that tower grow into a castle, and it emerges more beautiful and full of life and meaning than it has ever had before. And then? You really ARE okay.
author: Skyler

text:
Как бороться с одиночеством?

Улыбайся все время,

Блистая зубами, даже без повода,

Затачивай их об ложь.



И что бы ни случилось,

Это будет следовать за тобой по пятам.

Вот как борются с одиночеством:

Смейся над каждой шуткой,

Безрассудно тяни одеяло на себя,

Наполни сердце дымом,

И первое, что ты захочешь,

Будет последним, что тебе понадобится -

Вот как с этим борются.



Просто улыбайся все время,

Просто улыбайся все время,

Просто улыбайся все время,

Просто улыбайся все время...
